title: Nature: Which is the oldest tree in India and where is it located? - Quora

response.answer_text: Who PROMETHEUS What 5200 YEAR(S) Where UNITED STATES (MT WHEELER) When 1963 The oldest age for a tree that has ever been recorded is approximately 5,200 years old. A bristlecone pine (Pinus longaeva) known as Prometheus was cut down from Mt Wheeler in Nevada, USA in 1963. Although 4,867 rings were counted, the tree was growing in a harsh ennvironment which slowed its development, and thus its actual age is believed to have been approximately 5,200 years old. The ring count was taken at 2.4 m (8 ft) above the base. Prometheus measured 5.1 m (17 ft) high, 1.8 m (6 ft) in diameter and grew at an elevation of 3,048 m (10,000 ft) in very harsh conditions. Prometheus has the record for the highest ring count. Source : Google. And Guinness world records documentary.
The great Banyan tree in the Acharya Jagadish Chandra Bose Indian Botanic Garden in Howrah (Kolkata).  All these prop roots belong to the same tree.  That is one big tree.
